Despu√©s de unos d√≠as, nos dimos cuenta de que no hab√≠a sido hecho a nuestra cuenta de cr√©dito, mi mujer llam√≥ de nuevo s√≥lo para aprender que nuestro n√∫mero de tel√©fono hab√≠a sido bloqueada por el restaurante.El √∫nico recurso que ten√≠amos era ponerse en contacto con nuestro banco, y disputa el cargo Citbank. Es una gran noticia que sigan activos en Puntarenas. Esperamos volver de nuevo

Muy buena, la atenci√≥n fue excelente... Es √∫nico inconveniente es que es algo alejado por lo que hay que ir en carro propio o pagar un taxi, pero el visita este lugar que seguro quedara encantado

Direccion: South and 700 M East of the store La Palma 300 M, Puntarenas 60101 Costa Rica
Comentario: We were recommended the Canopy/Zip Lining Tour by our hotel, Cabinas Jimenez. The tour was exciting,exhilarating, beautiful and informational. Nice hike to the top after a couple of practice/shorter lines into the valley, so not for someone that does not like to walk/hike. The guides will take as long as you need though so don't let a little 1000 ft (up) hike scare you away. I would not recommend if you are afraid of heights as you end up 200+ feet in the canopy, along with the squirrel monkeys. We saw many of those and a Toucan while on the tour. Our guide, William, was great and spoke excellent english. If you are looking for a fun activity on the Osa Peninsula then this one is for you!

Direccion: South and 700 M East of the store La Palma 300 M, Puntarenas 60101 Costa Rica
Comentario: This review is for the Osa Palmas Canopy Tour. We had a wonderful experience on this tour recommended to us by Casa Bambu. After watching the video of the tour on YouTube, I was worried about our kids ages 9, 8, and 4 as they climbed the staircases to the platforms. However, I felt very safe once we started the tour. Equipment was in great condition and we were attached to the cables as we climbed and waited our turns. My 4 year old went with our guide, Eduardo. We tried her on the first line to determine if she would stay back with one of us and after her trial she had a huge smile and told us she wanted to go again. The platforms, views, and forest experience exceeded our expectations. We zip lined in Maui before and if we had done the Osa Palmas tour first, we would have been so disappointed‚Ä¶.now we are spoiled for life! The forest walks were beautiful too and we got to see toucans and Eduardo impressed our boys by catching lizards. Thank you for a great day. We hope to be back someday.

Direccion: South and 700 M East of the store La Palma 300 M, Puntarenas 60101 Costa Rica
Comentario: Stayed one night while waiting for a major storm to pass through on our way over to Bahia Drake in Dec 2013. Arrived in a major downpour. The little cabinas are very rustic but comfortable and very reasonably priced. The food at the restaurant was great. Awesome views over towards Golfo Ducle .Friendly Tico family owns and runs the place. Nice to still see some smaller family run places in CR and nicer still to be able to support them. Don't go in expecting 4 stars but very comfortable and reasonable.

Direccion: South and 700 M East of the store La Palma 300 M, Puntarenas 60101 Costa Rica
Comentario: We were staying at a lodge just outside of Guadalupe. One night when driving around looking for a local place to eat, we saw a sign for Osa Palmas Restaurant so we decided to check it out. The ride up the rocky dirt road was the worst. I was hoping the restaurant & food would make up for the trek there but it didn't. The place had a few people there, mostly locals and employees sitting around watching TV. The host was nowhere to be found so we had to sit ourselves. The menu was extensive. After our waiter showed up, it took a little over 45 minutes for our food to arrive. The food was mediocre at best. While dining, there were a few kids running around playing & screaming. It got to the point where I was about to ask our waiter to shut them up. Apparently, someone thought it would be a good idea to make it a family friendly place and put a kiddie swing inside the main dinning room. If there any other restaurants nearby I would have walked out and gone elsewhere but seeing as the restaurant sits atop a mountain surrounded by homes we were stuck. Don't bother to make the long rocky journey to this place, go somewhere else.

Comentario: Yellowfin es un lugar peque√±o pero acogedor en el centro de Puntarenas. Tiene una decoraci√≥n muy peculiar y un muy buen servicio al cliente. La decoraci√≥n de los platos es muy bonita. Los frescos naturales estaban ricos. El arroz con camarones no sobresali√≥ no s√≥lo por el sabor sino porque los camarones no estaban limpios. Si tenia bastantes camarones. Los dedos de pollo estaban simples.

Bien, razonables, un poco contradictorios pues un pollo a la plancha con arroz sali√≥ igual que un plato de camarones con arroz (en mi imaginario de precios culinarios, los camarones son m√°s caros que el pollo). ¬øServicio? Price-wise, reasonable for Santa Elena, but don't expect soda prices (mains 7000-9000 colones). Overall, good value for money and a nice atmosphere. We were served by both the owners and it was nice to support a local family business.

Comentario: This is a review of the Brazileirisimo in the Praiamar hotel. We had a pleasant evening at Brazileirisimo restaurant. It helped that we started with great company. But, Brazileirisimo contributed in the following ways:Nice ambience (although quiet, we were the only diners). Absolutely perfect Brazilian style caipirinhas (I highly recommend).Chitty chat (in English) with the lovely Brazilian owner.The food was uneven and the service okay but a tad slow. Top marks went to the Brazilian fish stew -- delicious; the steak which was just _too_ tough (and this is according to my husband who has truly embraced tough-but-tasty Central American cuts); I think with Central American beef you have to order it medium, not medium rare. The flavours of the stuffed squid were very good but the squid were rubbery.Another advantage is that this restaurant is an easy walk from the Puerto Azul hotel and the Yacht Club and a couple of other hotels. The restaurant is in the Praiamar hotel ‚Äî find it near the south east corner of the futbol field. This is not a destination restaurant but if you are in the Puntarenas area check it out: order a caipirinha and a moqueca de pescado, relax and enjoy.
